Key Match Events: Alex Hales celebrated the end of his international exile with a crucial half-century as England’s first match in Pakistan for almost 17 years ended with victory in the first Twenty20.
The opener cracked 53 in 40 balls on his first England outing since March 2019.
England restricted Pakistan to 158 for seven in front of a sell-out 35,000 crowd at Karachi’s National Stadium, with debutant Luke Wood claiming an impressive three for 24.
Harry Brook finished the job with a fluent 42 not out, including the winning four in the final over.
Phil Salt was brilliantly caught by Haider Ali after middling a pull to deep square.
Dawid Malan was caught and bowled immediately after launching the leg-spinner’s loosener for six.
Ben Duckett made an enterprising 21 before falling lbw on the sweep.
Mohammad Rizwan scored 68 and Babar Azam scored 31 for Pakistan.
Pakistan scored 71 and lost six wickets in the second half of the innings.
Rizwan was stumped off Moeen, who hurled one down after spotting the batter’s charge.
Iftikhar Ahmed scored 28 runs, including three sixes, before being dismissed by Wood.
Wood was trusted with the final over of the innings and responded with two late scalps.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England’s first match in Pakistan for almost 17 years.
Sell-out 35,000 crowd at Karachi’s National Stadium.
